availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Stephen D. Herndon (Maury County, Tennessee, physician and Justice of the Peace)

body.p: Maury County, Tennessee, physician and Justice of the Peace. Tennessee native. Married to Mary E. Herndon. Father of Joseph H. Herndon, Benjamin G. Franklin Herndon, Martha C. Herndon, Mary K. Herndon, Stephen D. Herndon, Jr., and Ann W. Herndon. Physician in Maury County, Tennessee, in 1850. Owned three enslaved persons in Maury County in 1850. Physician in Maury County in 1860. Justice of the Peace in Maury County in 1861.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Tennessee, Maury County, Columbia, p. 239A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Tennessee, Maury County, Columbia, District 10 p. 3 of 3 of microfilm, (accessed via Ancestry.com, April 18, 2021).
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Tennessee, Maury County, District 9, p. 358.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Tennessee, Maury County, Columbia, Ward 3, p. 334A.
Find A Grave, "Stephen D. Herndon (1816-1902)," Memorial #86162792, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/86162792 (accessed April 18, 2021).
